H0.text: Evolution is the process responsible for the growth and repair of human tissue.

H1.text: Germination is the process responsible for the growth and repair of human tissue.

H2.text: Cell division is the process responsible for the growth and repair of human tissue.

H3.text: Natural selection is the process responsible for the growth and repair of human tissue.

A4.text: Mitotic cell division enables sexually reproducing organisms to develop from the one-celled zygote, which itself is produced by fusion of two gametes, each having been produced by meiotic cell division. After growth from the zygote to the adult, cell division by mitosis allows for continual construction and repair of the organism.

A5.text: Multicellular organisms replace worn-out cells through cell division.
